intro: Torilis peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian hedge mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with erect stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round, hairy fruits called siliques, which contain several seeds.
